definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)

sentences.english: Investors are obviously skittish, and small, new companies suffer in recessionary times.
sentences.chinese: 投资者蠢蠢欲动，而新的小公司受困于经济萧条时期。

sentences.english: Any preoccupation with ideas of what is right or wrong in conduct shows an arrested intellectual development.
sentences.chinese: 耽于权衡举止的孰是孰非，是心智发展受困的表现。

sentences.english: The miners were trapped underground for days after the entrance to the mine collapsed.
sentences.chinese: 矿井的入口处坍塌了，矿工在地底下受困好几天。

sentences.english: Doyle agonized over his dual loyalties.
sentences.chinese: 道尔受困于他的忠诚感。

sentences.english: I hate feeling fenced in by lack of money.
sentences.chinese: 我不愿意因缺钱而受困。

sentences.english: No matter what you do, you are stuck with the original design.
sentences.chinese: 不论您做出何等努力，都会受困于最初的设计。

sentences.english: Water Bougets - Conferred on those who had brought water to an army or besieged place.
sentences.chinese: 专用授予那一些曾经给受困的军队和古堡运送水的人。

sentences.english: If a man is able to serve the state, he is not hindered by the obscurity of his condition .
sentences.chinese: 有才能为国家服务的人不会因出身低微而受困阻。

sentences.english: He was unlucky many times with long-term injuries but it helped him to mature.
sentences.chinese: 不幸运的是，他长期受困于伤患，但是这能让他成熟。

sentences.english: The survivors were stranded on a desolate island.
sentences.chinese: 生还者受困在一个杳无人烟的荒岛上。

sentences.english: Look at those pictures, as airboats are being sent in to rescue the stranded residents.
sentences.chinese: 从图中可以看到，汽船正营救受困的居民。

sentences.english: Helicopters dropped supplies (ie of food, etc) for the stranded villagers.
sentences.chinese: 直升飞机给受困的村民空投了物资。

sentences.english: But News Corp continues to struggle with its digital offerings.
sentences.chinese: 但新闻集团还得继续受困于它的数字服务。

definition: to sustain injuries/wounded (in an accident etc)/harmed
caught in (a bad situation)/to fall into (trap etc)
to halt/to stop/to go no farther
to get into difficulties/to meet with danger
to rescue/to help out of difficulties/to save the situation
to get away/to escape (from obligations)/to free oneself/to disengage
